quest.name: Men of the Blue Tattoos
journal: Ghimthota wishes to entrust you with an important task.

Among the possessions of Ahtzapfyn, the pirate behind the plot to sabotage the Victory, a missive written in some manner of code has been discovered. Unable to find anyone capable of deciphering the curious lettering, Ghimthota wishes to enlist the help of Baderon and his colorful circle of acquaintance. Deliver the missive to the proprietor of the Drowning Wench.
After reading the contents of the missive, a visibly worried Baderon bids you prepare for the worst. Summon up your courage, and speak with him once more.
objectives: Deliver the arcane epistle to Baderon in Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Forename. In light of your role in recent events, there are few others to whom I would entrust this task.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Since last we spoke, a curious missive has been discovered amongst the personal effects of Ahtzapfyn, the pirate behind the plot to sabotage the Victory.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: This missive was penned in the most unusual script─a script we believe to be some manner of code.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Needless to say, anything which a proven enemy of Limsa Lominsa deems worthy of enciphering is like to be of great interest to the Maelstrom. Unfortunately, none among us can make any sense of the message.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: In cases such as this, I am told the Yellowjackets are wont to turn to Baderon and his convenient...connections.

dialogue.name: GHIMTHOTA
dialogue.text: Thus I would have you deliver this missive to the proprietor of the Drowning Wench. Into his hand, and no other, do you understand?

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Ahoy there, Forename! I've been 'earin' about your deeds at the Drydocks!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Ahtbyrm laid out the entire tale fer me. Poor sod was still reelin' at 'is old man's part in the business, but at least ye kept the Victory from bein' sunk afore she'd sailed.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: An' fer that, I owe ye me thanks!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Ye've really made a name fer yerself 'ere in Limsa, lasslad. Folk know that when they need summat doin'─

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Eh? You need summat doin'? An' what might that be?

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: ...Ye want someone to read a message writ in funny letters fer ye? An' Ghimthota thought I might know a man as could? Well, let's see it, then!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: ...I reckon I might know a canny bugger what can read stuff like this. Ugly sod by the name o' Baderon.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Ye know, yer like one o' me regulars now, Forename.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Ye've never let me down yet, an', Navigator 'elp me, I reckon I can trust ye.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Ghimthota was right to want this message deciphered... We've got us some trouble brewin', 'ere, an' no mistake. Get ready fer action, an' I'll explain.
